Short but enchanting

The perennial classic, Alice in Wonderland, doesn't quite come to life in this, because this isn't *that* story. This is before that story. And *this* story does come to life: as you descend deeper into the world of Wonderland, new scenes and areas unfold around you and you can always look back up to see the top of the rabbit hole.

This is technically a third person platform puzzle game, but with first person elements. Important dialog moments are first person, as are some puzzles. Splitting up between the two main characters--the girl and the Four and a Half--is needed to solve many of the puzzles, while some can be solved by only one character.

The game is full of beautifully-envisioned environments and plenty of references to the original classic by Lewis Carroll. The soundtrack is equally well-done and, I believe, is available on Steam.

Despite the approximately 2 hour length of the game, it is entertaining and enchanting (especially in the Mirror Realm) and has a pleasant nostalgic feel for those of us who grew up with Alice. The puzzles are somewhat challenging, but not too challenging. I recommend it if you're at all a fan of Wonderland and/or puzzle story games.
